messages.message: i’m seeing these failures again on this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/61902). Did anything change here in the last day? My PR was passing cypress yesterday but now it’s failing, it’s on current master too
it also says blocking and non-blocking :confused_dog:
@Travis
Jessica pointed this out to me and my PR also just failed. Let’s get this ironed out
the problem is the default state is wrong, so it doesn’t work correctly. I think I can get this fixed without a code change
cc @Xindi Xu on the unexpected case where a test was run in both blocking and non-blocking
interesting. It only ran once in the blocking group but the status is reported twice. i'll check my script
I see it reporting twice on all failures:
I reset the state of the `cypress-run-app` to be correct and I’ve deleted my PR craft box. I’ll see if this fixes it

Hm, it seems like Cypress has some issues with reporting the status and the failure tests. In my PR, only non-blocking test failed but the `STATUS_BLOCKING_xxx` is reporting `failure` as well. Will take a closer look

https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/13449/specs
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/actions/runs/10601119289/job/29381722948?pr=61955

I'm guessing that the latest cypress github action (released 3 hrs ago) changed some behavior that caused this
https://github.com/cypress-io/github-action/releases/tag/v6.7.4
seeing it fail still, but at least now its only showing up once

I have no idea if this will fix the issue, but at least it makes the tests that don't match the grep tag to run faster:
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/61995

I'm also having some tests infinitely running :grimacing: I think the non-blocking ones that are running when the results get reported?
https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/13445/specs
https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/13452/specs
I think these 2 are timeouts. I saw a lot of tests that just keep on running after timeouts

In 13445, the first one linked, the one running forever is documents-grid within the non-blocking section. That one isn't non-blocking, it should have been skipped. So I guess whatever test it's going over will just keeping "running" after the timeout
should we skip version-history @Travis?
yes we should
sorry, I haven’t been able to get the state of it to work
Aayush is on call this week so could you put up the PR to skip it Travis? And in the future I actually think we need our on call people to be in the PT-ET timezones
I have a PR I’ll tack it onto
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/62016
this is merged so feel free to update your branches and we should be good to go
